oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Sevierville Ten April 13th 1864 Orders No soldier Belonging to this Command Will Be Permited to Shoot nor wast there Amunishing. & No fencing nor garden truck Will Be destroid. No other depprepdations Will Be Commited. Except By orders from theas quarters. Any soldier violating this order Will Be sevierly punished. The Bell Will Be Rung Night & Morning for Role Call & Pickets and in Case of an alarme and at no other time. All Soldiers Will Ansure to Role Call or is to Be accounted for By order of G. W. Anderdown 1st Lt Comdey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Order issued by Federal 1st Lieutenant G. W. Anderdown that all in his command be prohibited from wasting ammunition, destroying fencing and garden trucks, or other depredations. The bell was to be rung for morning and night roll calls and pickets. All soldiers were to answer roll call and be accounted for. Soldiers found violating the order were to be "severely punished."

General orders have the force of law within the unit where they are issued.
